reviewText: Our now 17month old son first saw Timmy Time commercials on a Bob the Builder DVD.  He imitates the sounds Timmy makes!  Fair warning- there is no talking, it is all just animal sounds but you can almost tell what they might be saying based on body language and what they are doing.

MY SON LOVE TO WATCH TIMMY, HE IS SO FUNNY. MY SON HAVE ME AND MY MOM WATCHING TIMMY HE ALWAYS GET'S INTO SOMETHING.HE REALLY MAKE'S YOU LAUGH ALOT.PLEASE BUT THIS FOR YOUR KIDS.
PLEASE ENJOYED..THANK YOU..

My daughter loves Timmy and Shaun the Sheep etc... Timmy time is more educational and age appropriate for my 2 year old than Shaun the Sheep i, although STS isn't bad or anything. I don't feel bad sitting her in front of the T.V to watch this while i get some chores done like other children programming I've seen.

My granddaughter watched her first timmy time so much it was driving the rest of us crazy so we bought several more timmy times to give the rest of us a break. the little ones really love timmy, great for 3-4 year olds

If you have never seen Timmy Time before it is a spin-off of Shaun the Sheep made especially for preschoolers.  "Timmy Needs a Bath" is an adorable DVD featuring Timmy and the gang basically being mischievous kids.  Timmy just keep getting in mess after mess at preschool with mud, glue, and paint!  What is nice about this show is the characters don't talk, they do make noises but no talking so kids can actually focus on the characters actions.  The show made me and my boys laugh at the sillyness of the characters.  There is five fun episodes on this DVD perfect for kids to watch a bunch of episodes in a row or watch one here or there since they are short episodes.
"Timmy Time" is a fun watch for toddlers and preschoolers.  The characters are so much like childrens in their actions that children and teachers can relate.
My two year old grand daughter loves Timmy
our 2 year old grandchild loves all of these videos
My boys can not get enough of Timmy.  They are current 3 and 2 but have loved it since about 1.5.
My grandson loves these cd's  Timmy Time is very age appropriate.
Timmy is wonderful! My daughter who is 3 1/2 has been watching him for the last year and a half and he is still one of her favorites.
timmy time and shaun the sheep are one of my favorite mini series for kids..

My young one loves Timmy and Shaun videos, and watching the stop motion animation is fascinating for me. The video has lessons for the little ones and is very sweet in the way they work out problems. It could interest pre-school and slightly older kids as well.
I can get anything done by my toddler by just letting him watch the DVD. He just loves Timmy time.
